EmailTemplate.description: The lead submitter receives an email indicating that the lead they referred has been disqualified and or was a duplicate.
EmailTemplate.name: Lead Seeker - Lead Disqualified or Duplicate
EmailTemplate.subject: Seeker Rewards Program – Unsuccessful lead {!Lead.Lead_Number__c} for {!Lead.Company}
EmailTemplate.textOnly:
Dear {!Lead.First_Name_Formula__c},
Thanks again for taking part in our Seeker Rewards Program.
Unfortunately, the lead you submitted could not be progressed for the following reason: {!Lead.Disqualified_Lead_Reason__c}
But what does this actually mean?
Here’s a clearer explanation of why some leads don’t progress to the ‘opportunity stage’:
Could Not Contact We tried to contact the customer, but they couldn’t be reached or did not respond to our calls / emails Declined by customer The customer wasn’t open to having a sales-related conversation of any type Enquiry does not meet criteria The enquiry from the customer does not relate to a new business opportunity (i.e. it may be a tracking enquiry, a complaint, etc.) Existing customer, no opportunity The customer is already using the most suitable Australia Post products and services
When a lead doesn’t progress for any of the reasons above, no points are awarded. But don’t be disheartened! Every lead is valuable, so please keep up the great work and keep the leads coming. The next lead you submit could be the one that earns you lots of points!
Regards, The Seeker Team
